DataHubFileInfo.description: Information about a DataHub file - a file stored in S3 for use within DataHub platform features like documentation, home pages, and announcements.

bucketStorageLocation.description: Info about where a file is stored

originalFileName.description: The original filename as uploaded by the user

mimeType.description: MIME type of the file (e.g., image/png, application/pdf)

sizeInBytes.description: Size of the file in bytes

scenario.description: The scenario/context in which this file was uploaded

referencedByAsset.description: Optional URN of the entity this file is associated with (e.g., the dataset whose docs contain this file)

schemaField.description: The dataset schema field urn this file is referenced by

created.description: Timestamp when this file was created and by whom

BucketStorageLocation.description: Information where a file is stored

storageBucket.description: The storage bucket this file is stored in

storageKey.description: The key for where this file is stored inside of the given bucket

AuditStamp.description: Data captured on a resource/association/sub-resource level giving insight into when that resource/association/sub-resource moved into a particular lifecycle stage, and who acted to move it into that specific lifecycle stage.

time.description: When did the resource/association/sub-resource move into the specific lifecycle stage represented by this AuditEvent.

actor.description: The entity (e.g. a member URN) which will be credited for moving the resource/association/sub-resource into the specific lifecycle stage. It is also the one used to authorize the change.

impersonator.description: The entity (e.g. a service URN) which performs the change on behalf of the Actor and must be authorized to act as the Actor.

message.description: Additional context around how DataHub was informed of the particular change. For example: was the change created by an automated process, or manually.
